metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7183 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the decodearr function in ntpq in ntp 4.2.8p6 through 4.2.8p10 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging an ntpq query and sending a response with a crafted array.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1').
